docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Once again Dr. C. Everett Koop, Surgeon General of the United States, has confounded the White House and Congress, liberals and conservatives. This time he told President Reagan in a letter Monday that, after extensive study, he could not conclude one way or another that abortions were harmful to women.

headline.main: Koop's Stand on Abortion's Effect Surprises Friends and Foes Alike

docs.snippet: LEAD: Once again Dr. C. Everett Koop, Surgeon General of the United States, has confounded the White House and Congress, liberals and conservatives. This time he told President Reagan in a letter Monday that, after extensive study, he could not...

byline.original: By MARTIN TOLCHIN, Special to the New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: There is a general practitioner in Florida who, while he may not realize it, is being watched from Connecticut. Those monitoring his performance do not like what they see.

headline.main: Taking a Scalpel to Health Costs

docs.snippet: LEAD: There is a general practitioner in Florida who, while he may not realize it, is being watched from Connecticut. Those monitoring his performance do not like what they see.
